div.p: Relationships between aerosol burden, radiative forcing, and temperature change. The ratio of aerosol optical depth produced by the atmospheric burden of sulfate, black carbon, and organic carbon to its absorbing component (AOD/AAOD) ( a, y-axis) explains 60% of variance in effective radiative forcing ( a, b, x-axis), which in turn has differing efficacy ( b, diagonals) at producing global mean temperature changes ( b, y-axis). Error bars capture the standard error
